newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares recover but sentiment fragile.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares recover but sentiment fragile.

text.p: Norwegian shares traded higher on Wednesday to recapture day-earlier losses, but sentiment among investors remained fragile, brokers said.
"There's a lot of confusion and uncertainty in the market. Domestic and foreign investors are cautious," said one broker.

The uneasy situation in the Middle East, the U.S. presidential elections, U.S. payroll data at the end of the week and a rise in interest rates were all contributing to the uncertainty, the broker said. "There's also total confusion over macroeconomic indicators, one minute we're heading for recession, the next it's boom time."
The Total share index added 10.49 points, or 1.28 percent, at 829.55 points versus a fall of 0.9 percent on Tuesday.
Turnover at almost 10 billion crowns, a staggering figure, included 9.4 billion crowns from the merger of Transocean with U.S. drilling group Sonat Offshore to form a new company Transocean Offshore.
"The market was down one percent yesterday so it's up one percent today. It's over-reaction and psychology that's running this business," another broker said.
